acqinfo.p: The record group was donated in 1958 by Mrs. Robert E. Morse of Pigeon, Michigan (donor no. 3432). Additions were received in 1963.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

altformavail.p: The originals of these records are located in the library. Researchers will normally be expected to use the microfilm edition

bioghist.p: The German Christian Agricultural and Benevolent Society of Ora Labora was a German communal colony founded near Bay Port, Michigan by Emil Baur.

scopecontent.p: The records of Ora Labora date from 1862 to 1895 and include minutes, accounts, constitution, maps, and other related papers. Some of the records are in German with some English translation.
